post.body: Interesting. Thanks for the link. I'll consider.
Here's a link for Laubach's Letters By A Modern Mystic. http://twurl.nl/jbr4vq Here's an Amazon link: http://twurl.nl/kq17ti
In middle of Financial Management comprehensive final. The cookies (Oreos) are working out great...1 for students; 2 for me. lol
No, just quantitative methods, statistics, regression models, etc.
Great idea. Haven't before but I will today.
Done. I've mark your tweet as a favorite so I'll remember.
if I had some I would...but alas a lack...not possible...when I've some leftover I'll post a pic...then it'll be up to you.
I wish you hadn't mentioned pizza...haven't had breakfast yet...now all my juices are active...don't think ceral will do it.
what kind of thoughts are you having about tea. It's ok, you can tell us. ;-)
Yep, that's one part of me. The other part of me comes from undergrad schooling-philosophy & religion. Was headed toward seminary.
Now I have. Thanks.
Sure thing. Enjoyed them. Thought others might also.
Thank you. And you also.
Appreciate the tweet but it's not my birthday it's @bayareava 40th.
Appreciate the tweet but it's not my birthday it's @bayareava 40th.
Heard today's your birthday. Wanted to say 'happy birthday' Bet your mom was glad with this day arrived. ;-)
I'm am blessed. I hope you're having a good Christmas season too.
Just a quick tweet to let u know I'm following you & would be honored to be part of your 'tree.'
thanks. The Bible says, we are fearfully & wonderfully made. When ur nieces know this, they will be on the road to fulfillment.
thanks for the encouragement.
that's kewl (I think that the way it's spelled here.) Now 'quirks' that's a physics term correct? lol Is it a noun or verb?
Father, you've placed this on my heart 4 a few days now. In Jesus name & 4 your glory, release your healing virtue & touch Lewie.
sure tihing. Perhaps I've forgotten but I don't remember his name.
true, but where there's a will...we were always able to find a way when my wife & my sons went camping in 'primitive' places.
btw, how's your laptop working?
reminds me of when my grandfather, my bother & I would go 'cool off' in the river during the summer in Missouri.
that's funny. Would be wonderful to see it. Great to be able to laugh at things like that.
plan on blogging more in the new year.
well, I've found a new blessing - no bow hunters. lol
it will be my pleasure. Next semester will have a lighter load so I'll have more that for that & other things I want to pursue.
yes it great. Truly a gift from God. Has a long story related to it. Someday maybe I'll blog about it. Have about 80 pine trees.
I sure hope there aren't any environmentals following this exhange. lol
we have about 2 acres so neighbors are a little distance away. Visiting 'mother nature' requires prudence of course.
thanks for the encouragement. Although we don't normally need much. Laugh lots together.
RT Take a wow break. @SarahJL: Gorgeous winter trees: http://tinyurl.com/6qlghh
"People over all the world are withering because they are open toward God only rarely. Every waking minute is not too much." - F C Laubach.
We do not think of 1 thing. We always think of the relationship of at least 2 things, & more often of 3 or more things simultaneously. - FCL
"Concentration is merely the continuous return to the same problem from a million angles." - F C Laubach
"If our religious premises are correct at all then this oneness with God is the most normal condition one can have." - F C Laubach
"Can little children be taught to talk and listen to God inwardly all day long, and what is the effect upon them?" - F C Laubach
"Can a politician keep in a state of continuous contact with God, and not lose the following of the crowds?" - F C Laubach
Fill my mnd w/ Thy mnd 2 the lst crevice. Catch me up n Thine arms & make ths hour as terribly glorious as any human being ever lived...-FCL
My job hr is't to go 2 the town plaza & make proselytes, it's to live wrapped in God, trembling 2 his thoughts, burning w/ his passion.-FCL
"I feel sure now that our thoughts flow around the world even when we do not express them." - F C Laubach.
Have you begun your preparation to make next year the best you've very had in you life?
"But anticipation! To be able to look ahead and say, "The present year can and shall be better!"--that is more glorious!" F C Laubach
"To be able to look backward and say, "This, this has been the finest year of my life" --that is glorious!" - F C Laubach
Dr. Frank Laubach was called the 'Apostle to the Illiterates.' You can read more about him here: http://twurl.nl/0o7lfy
Let me introduce you to someone you may not know. He is a modern Christian Mystic. His name is Frank Charles Laubach (1884-1970).
Time to get ready & go to school. Peace be with you till we meet again.
3Q - Ans: 1) now, 2) the person you're with, 3) making that person happy -- the Emperor's three questions, Tolstoy.
3Q: 3)what is the most important thing to do at all times? -- the emperor's three questions, Tolstoy
3Q: 2) Who are the most important people to work with? -- the empoeror's three questions, Tolstoy
3Q: 1)What is the best time to do each thing? -- the Empoeror's three questions, Tolstoy.
RT @karencook: Pen spinning at your desk can be dangerous...watch to the end! http://bit.ly/MHgE Good morning sweet tweeps!
RT n twitter slct DM, slct Sent @SmBizGuru: RT @rhonda_brown: @tweetdeck I wish there was a way to see the DM's that I have sent... ME TOO!
RT Time to act, now! @KristinKopp: Today is the day. Today is the day. Today is the day. What will you use today to do?
RT Recommended @mclouthier: Orgasms During Childbirth: http://tinyurl.com/57ww2y
Self-discipline is often the missing ingredient in personal success. Without it, desire remains only perpetual potential.
Now I can say good morning. Just finished grading all assignments for my 2 Financial Mgmt classes. Now just need to calculate final grade.
RT @onlinemlmpro: 3 Components of sccss: 1.Prctice delayed gravitation, 2.Understand the principle of compounding, 3.Have lng term vision!
Time to leave school & go home. Supper & then more grading. I'm beginning to get caught up.
RT @jennifertribe: RT @Maggie Coffee shop etiquette for the Wi-Fi set: http://tinyurl.com/6pl8qp
Good morning all. I up, alert, & getting ready to take my final grades for my classes to school to turn them in to Academic Records.
At home. Time to focus on preparing my final grades. Need to turn them in tomorrow morning by 9 am.
RT @mljlive: Traffic isn't everything. Start from the ground up. Think value, think content, think of others.
RT @blairwarren: The trickiest part of creating and maintaining a powerful identity is making it look like you're not.
RT @blairwarren: There's a difference between buying ideas and buying into ideas. One can provide education. The other, transformation.
Immanuel - God with us. Worth celebrating. Sing No·ël.
Getting ready to go to a dinner at church as part of our Christmas celebration.
Time to move upward & onward through the muck & mire. ;-) Will return later, God willing. May you know God & His blessings today.
Reviewing preparation for today's Sunday School topic: 'Slaves to Obedience that leads to Righteousness.'
O come to the Father, through Jesus the Son, & give Him the glory, great things He hath done! --Fanny. J. Crosby. Hallelujah!
Good morning all. Having my first cup of tea. WIll follow with coffee & breakfast.
Good night. Been a loooooonnnnnnnnnnggggggg day.
When personal time is divided into smaller & smaller units to meet every increasing responsibilities what remains is an empty individual.
Home from Commencement w/ contraband...three, large, beautiful red poinsettias. Waiting to go to town for lunch & shopping w/ wife & MIL.
Had a bagel for breakfast, some entertainment & conversation via tweets, coffee is ready, time to head to Commencement at school. Later.
At home. Grandkids playing on living room floor, MIL in rocker watching fireplace, wife & DIL n kitchen making cookies & evening meal.
When we quit worrying about who we should be, we can be who God created us to be. And, that's freedom mixed with pure joy.
